comment:
/** * Indicate whether the given response has any errors. *

Implementations will typically inspect the * {@link ClientHttpResponse#getStatusCode() HttpStatus} of the response. * @param response the response to inspect * @return {@code true} if the response indicates an error. {@code false} otherwise * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors */
code:
/** * Indicate whether the given response has any errors. *

Implementations will typically inspect the * {@link ClientHttpResponse#getStatusCode() HttpStatus} of the response. * @param response the response to inspect * @return {@code true} if the response indicates an error. {@code false} otherwise * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors */ boolean hasError(ClientHttpResponse response) throws IOException.

comment:
/** * Handle the error in the given response. *

This method is only called when {@link #hasError(ClientHttpResponse)} * has returned {@code true}. * @param response the response with the error * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors */
code:
/** * Handle the error in the given response. *

This method is only called when {@link #hasError(ClientHttpResponse)} * has returned {@code true}. * @param response the response with the error * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors */ void handleError(ClientHttpResponse response) throws IOException.

comment: /**  * Alternative to {@link #handleError(ClientHttpResponse)} with extra  * information providing access to the request URL and HTTP method.  * @param url the request URL  * @param method the HTTP method  * @param response the response with the error  * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors  * @since 5.0  */
code: /**  * Alternative to {@link #handleError(ClientHttpResponse)} with extra  * information providing access to the request URL and HTTP method.  * @param url the request URL  * @param method the HTTP method  * @param response the response with the error  * @throws IOException in case of I/O errors  * @since 5.0  */ default void handleError(URI url, HttpMethod method, ClientHttpResponse response) throws IOException {     handleError(response). }
